-----------------------------------------
Game Rules:
These rules are to be followed at all times. Failure to do so may result in disciplinary action ranging from a warning to being force-replaced or modkilled.

i) This is a game so try and have fun! Don't be mean to other users by flaming, trolling or calling names. Remember the general site rules apply at all times!
ii) No trickery: No invisible, encrypted, or small text in thread.
iii) You may not edit or delete any posts, if you have the power to do so.
iv) Don't discuss this game outside of the main thread, unless your role specifies you have the permission to do so.
v) Do not quote role PMs or any information said in PTs/QTs outside the related threads. Paraphrasing is allowed, but I would recommend you run it through me first before you do so.
vi) Do not impersonate the mod in-thread. Do not use my mod colour, #804000.
vii) Faking a violation will give you the same penalty as actually committing it.
-----------------------------------------
Game Mechanics
The information below describes how the game works. Some of these modified from various other people.

i) Votes must be bolded, or made using the vote tags. Either Vote: Cheetory6 or VOTE: Cheetory6 is acceptable. On the other hand, if it looks vaguely like a vote, I'll count it.
ii) Lynches require a majority of votes. If a majority is not reached by deadline no lynch occurs.
iii) Once a lynch occurs, the game enters twilight and players may continue to talk in thread until the death scene has been posted. No votes/unvotes will be counted during this period.
iv) Once you're dead, you're dead. No more talking. No 'Bah' posts.
v) All actions will be resolved using the Natural Action Resolution system.
vi) Each Day will have a two week (14 day) deadline. Deadline extensions don't happen unless on extraordinary circumstances.
vii) Each Night will have a 48 hour (2 day) deadline. All night actions must be submitted to me (Cheetory6) by PM during that time.
viii) If you're going to be V/LA, please notify me in thread (preferably bolded with @mod or @Cheetory).
ix) Players must post every 48 hours or they will be prodded. Three total prods during the game will result in a replacement. If a player fails to pick up on their prod and post in-game within 24 hours, they will be replaced also.
x) All flavour is provided purely for entertainment purposes only and has no bearing or relation to the game.
xi) Please review the Natural Action Resolution guidelines.
xii) This game will have three mafia and ten town.
-----------------------------------------
Sample Role PM
At least one player has received a 'vanilla town' PM like the one below:
Welcome to the Mafia Café Cheetory6!
-----------------------------------------
Vanilla Townie:
-----------------------------------------
--(--- i) Vanilla: You can post, vote, die and that's about it!
---)-- ii) Townie: You are aligned with the Town and win when all threats to the town have been removed and at least one member of town remains.
c[■]-
-----------------------------------------

RolePMs are out. Game will start in either 24 hours or when 10/13 have confirmed.
9/13

I thought the specific reason he provided -- that he was leaving within his own ISO a note about a possible player relationship -- was kind of bizarre. Nervous/lying doesn't sound right to me Johnny, because like Optilex said in 32, he could easily have told us it was banter-y bullshit and moved on. If Simple really posted the way he did for the reason he says he did, AND he was willing to be completely transparent about it immediately after posting, why bother phrasing it the way he did? Why not tell us, "I'm noting possible distancing between MoSa and Johnny" right off the bat? It would benefit his ISO the same way, and it would have spared him the negative attention. I don't know, I just got this impression that Simple wasn't afraid of the negative attention, which is vaguely, slightly, just-a-bit town-ish? He's not reading as scummy to me yet, at the very least.

Ugliest posts so far have been Davsto's & Jester's, but perhaps that's only because (like JakeFSF) I don't think you can characterize Simple's posts thus far as "defensive." Yes, that's a weirdly robust rationale for an LOL+RVS post, but if he was ever defensive it was the "Do you have a problem with that?" response to Jester, and not in his original response to Johnny. I guess my RVS Cowbells vote is a moot point now, so here.

Marvin / Fitz scum team is highly unlikely, but there's definitely one between the two of them. Marvin's posts in and of themselves read scummier to me, but we shouldn't ignore fitz's almost complete inability to defend himself. All of his decidedly meager town cred comes from sheeping around, and fashioning himself the harmless bro of any Stool-voter whenever he's pressed about anything. Not sure yet what to make of the fact that the wagon on fitz fell apart almost *instantly* -- who fled it and when? -- but just making a note of it here in case I don't get the chance to dig into that.

Although there's a possibility Johnny is (A) a scum goon who (B) did not perform the kill on Jake, my result from last night is a strong point in favor of the near-universal opinion that Johnny is town. I wish I had something more controversial to spill, since I'll likely be accused of resting a scum-gambit on a safe target, but them's the breaks. I also believe Chaos is town, primarily I guess because his case against me is actually good. I'll admit it. I let myself get preoccupied with this idea of a shadow wagon being primed against Monkey (who I also read as town) which is pretty silly in retrospect. I still think my basic idea of this thing was pretty cool, there's just no way it's actually happening in our game.

To elaborate on the Monkey thing, I've already said that I think most of the suspicion on him has been manufactured by others, more often than not Cowbells. Forgive me this pretension, but the situation with him is a little Kafkaesque. How many times did this happen: Monkey says something, Someone says "That's bad," and then Monkey is forced to defend himself against an unknown charge which in the simple act of acknowledging the accusation, will always read like an admission of guilt. The points against him are all ciphers in my eyes.

HCL is probably town, and that last post/fitz-vote supports that in my opinion. Can't say I have a big read on ASP, and Lynx is entering the game inheriting what I consider a decent basis for a scumread of that slot, but I don't recommend putting him on the defensive until he contributes some self-generated analysis. I've been ambivalent about Cowbells for the duration of the game, and this interchange with Titus doesn't really do much to influence that one way or the other, I'm sad to say. Titus is definitely being theatrical, but I don't see how that could be a scum-tell in itself, and RC has demonstrated himself to be nothing if not protean, so I can't completely reject the idea that RC is mining Titus's net-neutral theatrics for some easy town cred - the kind that is awarded for doing nothing but exercising rationality (and is thus, a little suspect). If theEMC had ever said anything at all, I could see Titus's behavior as a way to cover something up and draw attention to their posts over the original slot-holder's, but he didn't.

In any case, I'm still more or less at status quo, in that the two people I scumread hard enough to advocate lynching are Marvin & Fitz, but I know it's unlikely that the momentum of this day will change significantly enough to avoid my own lynch. This is difficult to articulate, but when I flip green, remember that Chaos's point about the case against me being similar to the one I'm mounting against Marvin is not a bad point. I obviously know that when it comes to me it's misguided, but don't consider my town-flip a refutation of Chaos's logic. Pursue it, cause it's a good lead.

Based on the info in your post, if you tally up the potential votes, this is what we get:

Monkey: 5 potential votes*
Titus: 5 potentialvotes
Fitz: 5 potential votes
Stool: 3 potential votes
Cowbells: 3 potential votes

The star on Monkey is based on the fact that Titus has expressed willingness to vote, but you didn't count her there. This would have made 6, but one of those Monkey votes is RC, who parked his vote on Titus before replacing out, so it shouldn't really count.

So as it stands now, we don't have enough voters for a majority on anyone, but both a Titus wagon and a Monkey wagon would only need one more voter to go through. I guess since I wasn't on either of those two my pledge would give us enough to lynch either.

So in my mind, it's basically for me to decide between Monkey and Titus -- two people I'd prefer not to vote at all, but for very different reasons. To answer Johnny's question about why I townread Monkey, I'll try to sum it up. Monkey has taken a number of difficult positions - not as in reachy, but as in he maintains a focus on investigation when it would be easier to go the populist route. Recent example is the "Only an idiot would vote their top suspect all day" post -- it's scumbaiting for sure, but as a position it also holds up against scrutiny. Most of the time, Monkey seems far more interested in scumhunting and getting info for the town than he does in self-preservation and it's really hard to find that scummy. On the reverse side of the equation, it seems like hardly anyone ever discusses why Monkey's posts are scummy. Everyone just says "That was gross" or "Monkey's post was bad," then other people agree, and then that's it. If the case against Monkey is that he's avoided the two major wagons, then I don't think there's much of a case at all. He didn't "avoid" Davsto -- like me, he thought it best to give the doctor claim a night on principle.

In the case of Titus, I really don't like how heavily she leans on the "If I was scum, why would I [fill in the blank]" defense, and as others have noted, unvoting RC when he decided to replace out without other provocation really undermines the integrity of that vote in retrospect. Even looking back now, I can't figure out why Titus unvoted. However, RC is one of my top scumreads, and to vote Titus I'd have to vote for the same player as RC which just seems like a mistake to me. After what happened, the possibility that both RC and Titus are scum is so small -- the only thing I can think of is that maybe they legitimately hate each other and each was trying to bus the other? Million to one odds on that though, so basically, for me to vote Titus would be to vote under the pretense that one of my scumreads is wrong.

TL;DR -- If I voted Titus, I'm voting under the pretense one of my scumreads is wrong, and if I vote Monkey, I'm voting under the pretense one of my townreads is wrong. Statistically, it's objectively more likely that I'm wrong about scum than about town, so although I'd definitely prefer to vote someone else entirely, I have to go with Titus over Monkey.
